intro: Ficus oleifolia var. major, commonly known as the large-leaved fig, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, pear-shaped fruits. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardening.
